required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HORizontal Instability AC Joint Study A Prospective Randomised Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Does Additional Horizontal Fixation After Arthroscopically Assisted Coracoclavicular Stabilisation Matter in Final Outcome Measures: a Prospective Randomised Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing different treatement strategies in augmenting clavicle stabilisation

primary_outcome.measure: Constant-Murley score, minimum score 1, maximum score 100 (higher = better)

secondary_outcome.measure: SACS - specific AC score, minimum score 1, maximum score 100 (higher = better)
Horizontal RTG measurements, measured in mm
Horizontal RTG measurements, measured in mm2

arm_group.arm_group_label: group with tape augmentation of acromioclavicular (AC) joint
arm_group.description: patients randomised in this group will have additional tape fixation around AC joint. Both groups will however have fixation in CC area.

arm_group.arm_group_label: group without tape augmentation of AC joint
arm_group.description: patients randomised in this group will not have additional tape fixation around AC joint. Both groups will however have fixation in CC area.

intervention.intervention_name: non-absorbable tape fixation around AC joint
intervention.description: fixation around AC joint with tape in different configurations
intervention.arm_group_label: group with tape augmentation of acromioclavicular (AC) joint

intervention.description: there will be no additional fixation around AC joint in this group
intervention.arm_group_label: group without tape augmentation of AC joint

intervention.description: mandatory coracoclavicular fixation with to suspensory systems, comprised of non-absorbable tapes and metal buttons
intervention.arm_group_label: group with tape augmentation of acromioclavicular (AC) joint
group without tape augmentation of AC joint

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- agreed indication for surgical treatment of AC syndesmolysis
- OP in 3 weeks after injury
- patient age above 16 years
- normal shoulder function before injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- open injury
- ipsilateral arm/shoulder girdle/hand injuries
- very low patient's physical demands
- previous injuries of the affected area
- Rockwood classification 1, 2, or 6
